description.narrative: Stöd till 2012 års folkräkning genom UNFPA. Målen är att stärka kunskapen om befolkningens sociala, demografiska och ekonomiska kännetecken för att möjliggöra formulering av livskraftig policy och att bidra till bättre förståelse av sambanden mellan befolkning och utveckling för att kunna utveckla mer sammanhållna utvecklingsprogram. Gemensamt stöd från sex givare.

Support to the 2012 Population Census through UNFPA, The objectives are to improve on knowledge of the social, demographic and economic characterisation of the population to enable the formulation of viable development policies; better understanding of population and development interrelationships in order to formulate coherent development programmes. Joint support by 6 donors.

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2017Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The 2012 Zimbabwe Population Census was able to provide current information on demographic and related socioeconomic characteristics of the population at national and sub-national levels which is currently being used for planning, monitoring, evaluation and reporting purposes by various Government Ministries and Departments as well as other organisations. Five examples might be cited. Firstly, the Ministry of Health and Child Care utilized the 2012 population census data to compute coverage rates of its various programmes which are reported in the 2012 National Health Profile. Secondly, the census data was also used by ZIMSTAT to develop a new master sample and sampling frame which has already been utilized for the 2014 Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS), Agriculture and Livestock (ALS), Information and Communication Technology Survey (ICTS) and the Labour Force and Child Labour Survey (LFCLS). Thirdly, UNFPA Country Office together with its implementing partners such as the Ministry of Women Affairs, Gender and Community Development, have utilized the census data to set and review targets for the Integrated Support Programme (ISP) which was being implemented in 26 districts of the country until December 2015. Fourth, some Members of Parliament have requested ZIMSTAT to provide them with basic demographic and socio-economic data of their constituencies. Fifth and lastly, there were several articles which appeared in the press tackling various issues emanating from the findings of the 2012 population census, including issues on access to safe water, housing and urban-rural migration.These articles have a bearing on Government policy issues such as the Growth Point Policy and the National Housing Policy.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
